content:
LÃ©o Lanteri Thauvin said:

Filed highfive#350 for the non-@ version

Is there a way to reassign a PR to somebody else in a team? I've tried a bunch of ways to reassign from myself (last time being https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/87900) but to no avail.
Try posting a new comment using the syntax r? rust-lang/compiler.
It wouldn't surprise me if highfive is like bors and doesn't look at edits to existing comments.
It's compiler-team, not compiler, I opened a bug but it hasn't been fixed yet

Hi, I seem to be doing something wrong here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90521#issuecomment-960606622

I tried both r? rust-lang/lang and r? rust-lang/lang-team but there was no reaction from highfive :(
looks like because there's no lang team group on highfive ? https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/blob/6e2c21639aaeafaeae423b244d353247c507d46a/highfive/configs/rust-lang/rust.json#L2-L79
Yeah, that's probably it. Thanks, @lqd !
I'll make a PR to highfive for this
(It seems painful that highfive has its own separate list, not connected to teams.)
In theory, I dont think its difficult to use the team data for this, but the big question is what to do when people don't want to review
We could track that information in the team repo as well. For each team, we could easily maintain both the list of members and the list of reviewers.
